item.title: Report X-2024120978
item.description:
Report X-2024120978

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-04
  • City: ACWORTH
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FOUR ROCKVILLE BATTERY PAR 61 ALUMINUM CASES ON WHEELS WERE INSPECTED TO DETERMINE IF HAZARDOUS MATERIALS MARKS OR LABELS ARE REQUIRED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED THREE CASES CONTAIN EIGHT ROCKVILLE BATTERY PAR 61 RECHARGEABLE LITHIUM BATTERY POWERED WASH LIGHTS. ONE CASE UNDER TRACKING NUMBER 1ZR366220110309926 CONTAINS SEVEN LITHIUM BATTERY POWERED WASH LIGHTS. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS TO THE SAME CONSIGNEE IN THE SHIPMENT ARE 1ZR366220137501024, 1ZR366220115469905 AND 1ZR366220110309926. ALL FOUR PACKAGES HAVE RETURN DOCUMENTS ENCLOSED POUCH APPLIED WITH GROUND RETURN TRACKING NUMBERS TO BE USED DURING THE RETURN PROCESS WHEN EQUIPMENT RENTAL IS COMPLETE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER ALUMINUM CASES. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED FROM GEORGIA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER R36622, USE SLINGSHOT LLC., 6182 AUTUMN VIEW COVE NW, ACWORTH GA 30101-7681.

item.title: Report E-2024120282
item.description:
Report E-2024120282

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-18
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1746 ET, Michael Reames with XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal NAT. It was reported that approximately 1 ounce of ConvoClean Forte released from 1) 2.5 Gallon plastic container due to improper loading. The release impacted trailer # 4631484. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. A contractor was dispatched and observed an estimated 1-quart release onto the wooden trailer floor in a 12’x3’ area. The contractor applied citric acid to neutralize the release and used absorbent pads to clean-up the release. Two 55-gallon poly drums were generated for waste disposal containing loose-packed product, neutralized absorbent pads, cardboard, and PPE. XPO will manage all of the waste generated from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved. The waste was staged for terminal personnel to manage.
